question: 撃つ
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>to attack</kanji>, though it usually means <vocabulary>to shoot</vocabulary>, because that's a very common way in which to attack someone. Pow!
sourceReadingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: Who are you going <vocabulary>to shoot</vocabulary>? You are going to shoot <reading>You</reading> (<ja>う</ja>). Why? Because there's another version of you in front of you, so if you don't shoot that version of you who is you, amirite?
